instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A folder sign on screen no ssd
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD</SIGNAL> is present
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL> not present
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_2V7_NAND_VCC</SIGNAL> not present 
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL> not presen
The costomer said the system Freez while he using it and he did a force shutdown. The problem started.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A folder sign on screen no ssd
threads.message:
What about other J9600 voltages?
Start checking pins 2 & 44.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A folder sign on screen no ssd
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A folder sign on screen no ssd
threads.message:
I hope you've checked with J9600 metal plate in place.
If the corresponding voltages from left side (reffered to schematic) are present, then J9600 has bad contacts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A folder sign on screen no ssd
threads.message: I have replaced J9600, still no ssd voltages

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A folder sign on screen no ssd
threads.message: Are the mentioned volatges present on left side?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A folder sign on screen no ssd
threads.message: just noticed <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> is extremely hot, and board still draws 20V, and the processor is also pretty warmed up. I couldn't continue because the <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> area was too hot. My question now is how can we have a bad <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip and board still draws 20V and processor still able to start up?? this is the very first time I'm see this!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A folder sign on screen no ssd
threads.message:
Why do you bother with USB-C, once board is booted?
So dificult to find why voltages from left J9600 don't pass to right side???
How much time do you need to check them?
I bet <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, or other chip don't have time to burn; if you do your job right.

BTW, <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> stil gets hot, if you connect charger on other port?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A folder sign on screen no ssd
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A folder sign on screen no ssd
threads.message:
Then change it.

BTW, any news about J9600 voltages???
